org.jcatapult.persistence
Interface Transaction

public interface Transaction

This class is a transaction facade that provides all the methods that most transactions will require and that all the backing implementations should support.

Method Summary
 void commit()
          Commits the transaction.
 boolean getRollbackOnly()
          Returns whether or not the transaction is roll back only.
 boolean isActive()
          Returns if the transaction is still active and has not been committed, rolled back or in any other way closed.
 void rollback()
          Rolls back the transaction.
 void setRollbackOnly()
          Sets the transaction into rollback only state.
 

Method Detail

commit

void commit()
Commits the transaction. This will throw exceptions if the transaction has already been committed, rolled back or the commit fails. Those exceptions are implementation dependent and are all runtime.

rollback

void rollback()
Rolls back the transaction. This will throw exceptions if the transaction has already been committed, rolled back or the roll back fails. Those exceptions are implementation dependent and are all runtime.

setRollbackOnly

void setRollbackOnly()
Sets the transaction into rollback only state. This will throw exceptions if the transaction has already been committed, rolled back or the setting of the rollback only flag fails. Those exceptions are implementation dependent and are all runtime.

getRollbackOnly

boolean getRollbackOnly()
Returns whether or not the transaction is roll back only.

Returns:
True if roll back only, false otherwise.

isActive

boolean isActive()
Returns if the transaction is still active and has not been committed, rolled back or in any other way closed.

Returns:
True if active, false it not.
